On 20.11.2008, at 14:12, Julian Reschke wrote:

> Stefan Tilkov wrote:
>> ...
>> I explicitly don't want to use PATCH or BATCH as examples, nor  
>> WebDAV.
>> Can anybody think of something else that's not obviously absurd and
>> would merit its own HTTP verb?
>> ...
>
> It would be interesting to know *why* you don't want to use PATCH,  
> or for instance, MKCOL, as example...
>

No particular reason except that I'm explicitly writing about verbs  
that are _not_ standardized anywhere.

Best,
Stefan


> BR, Julian
>
